task.title: Preparing the master host operating system

taskbody.context: This procedure prepares a RHEL/CentOS 7.1 or 7.2 host as a master host.
Perform this procedure on the primary node and on the secondary node.

step.cmd: Add the required hostnames and IP addresses of both the primary and the seconday node to the /etc/hosts file.

stepxmp.p: For a dual-NIC system, replace each variable name with the values designated for each node, and replace example.com with the domain name of your orgnanization:
stepxmp.codeblock: echo "Primary-Public-IP Primary-Public-Name.example.com \ Primary-Public-Name" >> /etc/hosts echo "Primary-Private-IP Primary-Private-Name.example.com \ Primary-Private-Name" >> /etc/hosts echo "Secondary-Public-IP Secondary-Public-Name.example.com \ Secondary-Public-Name" >> /etc/hosts echo "Secondary-Private-IP Secondary-Private-Name.example.com \ Secondary-Private-Name" >> /etc/hosts

stepxmp.p: For a single-NIC system, replace each variable name with the values designated for each node, and replace example.com with the domain name of your orgnanization:
stepxmp.codeblock: echo "Primary-Public-IP Primary-Public-Name.example.com \ Primary-Public-Name" >> /etc/hosts echo "Secondary-Public-IP Secondary-Public-Name.example.com \ Secondary-Public-Name" >> /etc/hosts

step.info: The utility is used to verify ZooKeeper ensemble configurations.

step.cmd: Remove any filesystem signature from the required primary partitions.

stepxmp.p: Replace each variable name with the path of the primary partition designated for each storage area:
stepxmp.codeblock: wipefs -a Docker-Partition wipefs -a Isvcs-Partition wipefs -a Metadata-Partition wipefs -a App-Data-Partition

step.cmd: Add mount points for XFS filesystems, which are created in subsequent steps.
